intro: Serratula flavescens var. mucronata, commonly known as the yellow fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. Its yellow flowers bloom in the summer, and the plant produces small, fluffy seeds that are dispersed by the wind. It is often found in disturbed areas and can thrive in poor soil conditions.
